Package com.ibm.eznosql

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.eznosql.Database
public class Database extends Object
The Database class represents an EzNoSQL database identified by its data set name. A database can be defined with a primary key or with an auto-generated key by omitting the key name. To create a new database, use fromDbParameters(String, String, DatabaseOptions). An existing EzNoSQL database may be re-instantiated with the Database(String) constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database(String dataSet) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Instantiates a Database object with an existing EzNoSQL data set. Note that this constructor does not create a new EzNoSQL database, so the user must verify that the provided data set name is a valid EzNoSQL database. In order to create a new database, use fromDbParameters(String, String, DatabaseOptions)
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The primary data set name (e.g., "MY.DATASET.NAME").
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name parameter is ill-formatted.

  • Method Details

    • fromDbParameters

      public static Database fromDbParameters(String dataSet, String key, DatabaseOptions options) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Instantiates a new EzNoSQL Database using a provided primary key.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The primary data set name (e.g., "MY.DATASET.NAME")
      key - The primary key (e.g., "\"my_key\"").
      options - The database configuration. See DatabaseOptions for usage details.
      Returns:
      An EzNoSQL Database instance associated with the provided data set name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • fromDbParameters

      public static Database fromDbParameters(String dataSet, DatabaseOptions options) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Instantiates a new EzNoSQL Database using an autogenerated key. Autogenerated databases use the reserved implicit key word "\"znsq_id\"" as its primary index key.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The primary data set name (e.g., "MY.DATASET.NAME").
      options - The database configuration. See DatabaseOptions for usage details.
      Returns:
      An EzNoSQL Database instance associated with the provided data set name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • createIndex

      public void createIndex(String altKey, String dataSetPath, String dataSetAIX) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Defines a secondary index with the provided alternate key, .PATH and .AIX index data sets. Note that the request cannot be completed while there is an active Connection. Issue the request prior to establishing a connection, or ensure that the database is disconnected via Connection.close() before invoking this method.
      Parameters:
      altKey - The alternate key name (e.g., \"my_alt_key\"").
      dataSetPath - The path data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.PATH")
      dataSetAIX - The AIX data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.AIX")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter is invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • createIndex

      public void createIndex(String altKey, String dataSetPath, String dataSetAIX, int maxSpace, EnumSet<IndexFlags> flags) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Defines a secondary index with the provided alternate key and secondary index data set. Note that the request cannot be completed while there is an active Connection. Issue the request prior to establishing a connection, or ensure that the database is disconnected via Connection.close() before invoking this method.
      Parameters:
      altKey - The alternate key name (e.g., \"my_alt_key\"").
      dataSetPath - The path data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.PATH")
      dataSetAIX - The AIX data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.AIX")
      maxSpace - The maximum space for the index in megabytes. If zero, the default is 10MB.
      flags - The indicator for unique alternate keys and/or the order of access. See IndexFlags for usage details.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the parameters are invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • addIndex

      public void addIndex(String dataSetAIX) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Activates a previously defined secondary index.
      Parameters:
      dataSetAIX - The AIX data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.AIX")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name parameter is invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • dropIndex

      public void dropIndex(String dataSetAIX) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Disables an active secondary index.
      Parameters:
      dataSetAIX - The AIX data set name (e.g., "MY.ALT.DATASET.AIX")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name parameter is invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.

    • delete

      public static boolean delete(String dataSet) throws EzNoSQLException, IllegalArgumentException
      Permanently deletes an EzNoSQL database.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The primary data set name (e.g., "MY.DATA.SET").
      Returns:
      true if the database was successfully deleted, false if the provided data set name could not be found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the data set name parameter is invalid.
      EzNoSQLException - If the call returned an error.
